A DTO class that encapsulates pagination parameters for cursor-based pagination in API requests, with built-in validation and default values.

## Key Components

- **cursor** - Base64-encoded pagination cursor string for navigating through result sets
- **limit** - Number of items to return per page (1-100, defaults to 20)
- **getLimit()** - Custom getter that enforces validation and provides default value

## Usage Example

```java
// Create pagination criteria with builder pattern
PaginationCriteria pagination = PaginationCriteria.builder()
    .cursor("eyJpZCI6MTIzNDU2fQ==")
    .limit(50)
    .build();

// Use in API request
@GetMapping("/api/users")
public ResponseEntity<PagedResponse<User>> getUsers(
    @ModelAttribute PaginationCriteria pagination) {
    
    // The limit will automatically default to 20 if null, 0, or > 100
    int effectiveLimit = pagination.getLimit(); // Returns validated limit
    
    return userService.getUsers(pagination.getCursor(), effectiveLimit);
}

// Create with defaults
PaginationCriteria defaultPagination = new PaginationCriteria();
int limit = defaultPagination.getLimit(); // Returns 20 (default)
```

The class uses Lombok annotations for boilerplate code generation and Swagger annotations for API documentation. The custom `getLimit()` method ensures pagination limits stay within acceptable bounds (1-100) and provides a sensible default of 20 items per page.
